veteran.text: James Brown, a gunner in the Murmansk Run, informs others the war is over
David Peat enlists in the Army
George Burrows loses his close friend in the Battle of Dieppe
Jan de Vries prepares as a bombardier for the D-Day battles in Normandy
Helen Crawley enlists and eventually becomes a motorcycle dispatch rider
Robert Guy enlists in the Army and volunteers for Royal Fusiliers' Parachute Regiment
Olive Peat is sent over to London as a clerk at the Canada House, the Canadian Military Headquarters.
Douglas Annis joins the Army as a lineman
Ernest Bone crosses the Atlantic to train at the Winnipeg Air Force Base
J.A. Brunette's crew on HMCS La Hulloise sink a U-1302 submarine
Bill Davis participates in the Battle of the Scheldt
Elizabeth Dimock travels to South Africa as part of the South African Medical Nursing Service
Helen Rochon experiences an air raid while stationed in London, England
Carol Duffus enlists in the Womens Royal Canadian Naval Service (WRCNS) and becomes a staff training officer
Hubert Gray participates as an Allied bomber in the Battle of El Alamein in Egypt
Bob Farquharson flies in supplies to Allied troops in Burma
Tom Rappel and crew on HMCS Haida battle two German destroyers off the Ile de Bas, France
Frank Aldred crosses the equator on HMS Prince Henry
Bernard Finestone and troops from the British Colombia Dragoons cross the Moro River in Italy
John Forbes is wounded in battle in Nijmegen, Holland
Corinne Sévigny joins the Canadian Womens Army Corps (CWAC) in Quebec City
Anthony Slugoski joins the Air Force and begins training
Harvey Burns trains as part of the Royal Canadian Navy in Cornwallis, Nova Scotia
John Springer is wounded near the border of Holland and Germany
Cyril Roach and crew leave the Isle of Wight to participate in D-Day landings
Jack Stapleton joins the Merchant Navy and is eventually deployed to Calcutta, India
Margarita Trull joins the Women Royal Naval Service (WRENS) and becomes a cryptologist (secret agent).
Leonard Allbon is stationed in England just as the Battle of Britain commences
Marie Duchesnay joins the Women Royal Naval Service (WRENS) and begins training in coding and de-coding
John Honsberger watches troops land on D-Day
Hugh Bartley crashes his Mosquito aircraft in Belgium
Jean Cauchy performs his last air raid over Hannover
Edward Beaven serves in Bethlehem on Christmas Eve
Edward Borland celebrates with Canadian troops and French civilians after the liberation of Dieppe
Robert Lundmark trains as a motor mechanic in Saskatoon
Stirling Squarebriggs is discharged from the Army
Hubert Lalonde was stationed in Woerdon when the war ends
Leonard Link goes to Alberta to undergo poisonous gas testing
Harold Bronson qualifies as an air navigator with the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Philip Kazimir enlists as a driver for the Argyles D Company
Mike Hawryliw participates in experimental gas testing in Suffield, Alberta
Roy Heron enlists in the Canadian Army
Arhtur Webster gets married before being stationed overseas
Mervyn Couse serves as a pilot during the Bombing of Dresden
Geraldine Muter is called up to serve in the British Commonwealth Air Training Program
Charles Kewen takes a two week leave while stationed in India
Melbourne Le Marquand is awarded a Military Medal for his actions in Bruuk, Holland
Alexander Scott enlists in the Air Force
Edith Middleton enlists and works as a "Lumber Jill" in Scotland
Brian MacConnell shoots down a German Arado aircraft
Donald McIntosh rides on HMS Queen Mary with Sir Winston Churchill
Donald Racicot serves in the military as a mechanic
Bill Watterson enlists in the Army
Murray Ginsberg joins the Royal Canadian Ordinance Corps band
Ed Pearson is assigned to Special Operations Executive (SOE), flying to Sri Lanka (then Ceylon)
Cecil Hancock enlists in the Air Force and trains in the praries
Louis Curran was stationed in the trenches in Holland when the war ends
May Gillman serves as a nurse while London is bombed
John McCarst boards HMCS Midland, his first time on a ranger ship
Norman Dawber flies in France as part of the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) 438 Squadron
Howard Love's squadron is re-equipped with Liberator aircrafts
Adeline Bowland is torpedoed en route to Europe
John Stephen serves on HMS Majola
Pierre Bauset is shot down returning from Frankfurt
Charles Scott serves on HMCS Fergus
Kenneth Wootton participates in the Battle of Verrieres Ridge
Anatole Cote crashes in Holland and stays hidden thanks to a Dutchman
John Slater joins the Royal Canadian Corps of Sgnals
Thomas Atherton joins the Merchant Navy and sails to India
John Covan and crew on the SS Green Gables Park avoid a Japanese submarine attack
Walter Hayden completes his tour with 432 Squadron
George Evans and crew on the SS Pieter de Hoogh are attacked departing Iceland
Margaret Brownlee is stationed in England as a driver
Robert Govan prepares for battle in Dunkirk, France
Ed Green carries out an airraid over the city of Essen
Bruce Little survives German submarine attacks while crossing the Atlantic
Robert Rodgers guards German Prisoners of War (POWs) in Quebec
Rex Fendick lands on Sword Beach as part of D-Day operations
Alec MacInnis spends his fourth consecutive Christmas away from his family
Allan Backman participates in the Battle for Caen
Lewis Billard begins training as part of the Royal canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Jean Carroll is stationed in a Scottish hospital as a nurse
Fred Allison participates in the Battle of the Bulge
Robert Atkins serves in the Aleutian Islands
Lawrence Wagg travels from North Africa to Italy
Mavis Butlin enlists in the Womens Canadian Royal Naval Service (WCRNS)
Murray Copot begins acitve service on HMCS Chippewa
Ella Curtis meets Princess Alice on her visit to the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) Women's Division in Canada
Bruce Agnew joins the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Mr. Alward survives German submarine attacks in the Atlantic
Doris Wallace plays in the Canadian Women's Army Corps (CWAC) Pipe Band for soldiers waiting to return home
Douglas Warren participates in the air battle in Dieppe
Jospeh Hawkins serves as an air bomber during D-Day
Douglas Drew serves as a Royal Air Force (RAF) mechanic in North Africa
Jean-Marcel D'Aoust fights in the doomed battle of Dieppe
George McLean and crew land a mobile hospital on Omaha Beach in Normandy
James Moffat experiences a mid-air collision and lands safely in a small Belgian town
Charles Owens is stationed in Antwerp after breaking through the Falaise Gap
Wilbert Prentice participates in a transport platoon during the Battle of the Scheldt
David Seagar undergoes jungle training in India before being stationed in Burma
Emile Thibault is released from a German Prisoner of War (POW) camp
David Havard crews a Bren Gun Carrier during the Battle of the Schedlt
Leonard Whiffen, aboard HMS Menestheus, aids in sinking German bismark
Francis Godon lands in Juno Beach on D-Day and is captured by the Germans
Bill Hembroff begins active service on HMCS Chippewa
Paul-Emile Lamouche is captured as a Prisoner of War (POW) in Cassino, Italy
Malcolm McLeod and Canadian troops support the British army in the Battle of the Bulge
William Kondra enlists in the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) and eventually earns numerous war medals
Grace Breau-Theriault works as a nurse in Pinewood, England
Joseph Friedman is shot down during a bombing raid of the town Witten
Malcolm MacConnell flies 21 operations with the 50 RAF Squadron
Malcolm Lunan repairs some of the convoy ships sunk with HMS Hood
Joseph Rivard enlists in the Army
Norman Silver and crew aboard HMCS Quatsino avoid German submarines
Peter Van Breevoort is detained in Vught concentration camp with his brother
Jim Peters and crew take Italian prisoners aboard HMCS Regina
William Gelineau joins the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) as a bomber
Robert Routledge is called for active duty with the Army
Jean Marie Milot completes Infantry training
Jean Clermont and his squadron are attacked by Germans in Canterbury
Ernest Randle enlists in the Navy
Robert Kerr is captured and serves as a driver for a German Prisoner of War (POW) camp
Leonidas Lemaire participates in the Battle of Monte Cassino
Andre-Paul Turin is stationed in Algeria with the French Army
Fred Linnington sails from Montreal to the Caribbean with the Merchant Navy
Harold Harden begins sailing the Atlantic as part of the Murmansk Run
Malcolm Young begins service with the 8th Reconnaisance Regiment
Olive Henderson begins training as a coder for the Women's Canadian Royal Navy Service (WCRNS)
Arthur Fraser is captured as a Prisoner of War (POW) during the Battle of Dieppe
Raymond Lewis serves as a Bren Gun Carrier at the Hitler Line
Geoffrey Jell arrives in Egypt in advance of the Battle of El Alamein
Earl Stiles works as a Medical Officer during the Normany Invasion on D-Day
Russell Smith trains at Camp Borden, Ontario
Gordon Partridge trains as a navigator with the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Raplh taylor serves aboard a minesweeper
Al Wallace is captured and is sent to a Prisoner of War (POW) camp
James Ritchie serves in the Royal Canadian Corps of Signals
Len Van Roon sends a note to his family after D-Day letting them know he's all right
Edison Yeadon's merchant ship is attacked and he is sent to a Japanese Prisoner of war (POW) camp
Allan Smith is transferred from the Buchenwald concentration camp to a Prisoner of War (POW) camp
Herb Pragnell is stationed in Italy near the Gothic Line
Marguerite Plante's brother is killed in action in Italy
Charles Ross joins the Canadian Film and Photo Unit
Okill Stuart participates in D-Day as part of the 3rd Canadian Infantry Division
George Mann capsizes his first truck in the landings on Normandy
William Adelman is shot and injured while stationed in Italy
Gordon Bannerman sees the Vatican while stationed in Italy
Glennis Boyce enlists in the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) Women's Division
Helen Arbuthnot serves in the Royal Canadian Medical Army Corps
Jack Smallwood begins serving on HMCS Skeena
James Smitherman crosses the Atlantic on HMCS Bittersweet
Donald Stevenson begins service in theRoyal canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Armond Emond fights with the 14th Army Tank Regiment in Dieppe
Eric Jensen serves as a cook aboard HMCS Haida
Jacques Nadeau is sent to a Prisoner of War (POW) camp and makes several unsuccessful attempts at escape
Sidney Appleyard enlists and serves as a guard at a Prisoner of War (POW) camp
John Potter and crew aboard HMCS Regina sink an Italian submarine
Otto Hemmerling is posted at a radar station in Queen Charlotte Islands
Andrew Miller enlists in the Army
Frank Dion enlists in the Navy
Borden Tymchuk serves as a fireman on the homefront
Douglas Smith begins training as a pilot with the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Nellie Rettenbacher enlists in the Canadian Army
Fred Maiden is stationed in Italy during the Battle of Ortona
Gertrude Luscombe enlists in Vancouver and serves in an Army mess hall
Ruby Foley travels with others from the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) to begin shutting down the eastern stations
Brian Murphy and troops enter Rome
Alan Cameron enlists in the Army
Eugenie Turner is posted overseas with the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) bomber command
Nigel Taylor is wounded advancing on the Hitler Line
Michael Faryna is stationed as an air mechanic in Brandon, Manitoba
Donald Green enlists in the Navy
Geoffry Arlington serves as a flying Instructor for the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Steve Lubky serves as a driver mechanic for the Army
Harold Walton enlists in the Army
Kenneth France serves in the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) Bomber Command
Doris Mitchell watches the planes fly over Sussex en route to Normandy
Henry Mason enlists in the Navy
Gerald James is liberated from a Prisoner of War (POW) camp
Robert Roth enlists in the Army
Arthur Brown enlists and eventually fights in the Battle of Monte Cassino
Ron Rhine returns home after his vessel, HMCS Niobe, is decommissioned
Lewis Chow enlists and serves as a spy
Bruce Findley ends his tour of the Pacific as the first atomic bomb is dropped on Hiroshima
Harry Ramsey is ordered to retreat in the evacuation of Dunkirk, France
Winifred Sirois joins the Army and trains in Morse Code signalling
Albert Sanderson enlists in the Air Force
Douglas Storey participates in the battle of the Falaise Pocket
Ray Sowerby enlists in the Army
Clifford Hobbs serves in the Army in Holland
John Pavey enlists as a Boy Seaman in the Royal Navy
Philip Zeman enlists in the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Robert Mason is permitted compassionate leave to visit his sick mother
Rod McNeill and a German soldier inform German snipers the war has ended
Arthur Lyon is stationed in Germany when the war ends
Herbert Shillington is stationed in North Africa in Tunis, Tunisia
John Marchand enlists in the Army
John Penner enlists in the Air Force
Frank Moore enlists in the Navy and serves as a 2nd Class Stoker
Bill Ramsbottom celebrates VE Day in Camp Shilo
Eric Saunders participates in the Allied invasion on Sicily
Stuart Richardson enlists in the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
James Fox is sent to the UK as an engineer for the Army
Stephen Bandurka ends his service with the Army
Jack Williams is certified as a Flying Instructor with the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Eric Hawley joins the Air Force
Michael Sich visits the Vimy Ridge Memorial in France
Edgar Branch helps a British pilot after a crash
Arthur Gillan enlists in the Navy
Joan Brownson enlists in the Army
Glenn Price and troops prepare vehicles for a victory parade in Holland
Rex Fendick is stationed in the English Channel when Victory in Europe is announced
Art Meyer sails for England as part of the Royal Canadian Electrical and Mechanical Engineers Corps
John Charlwood lands on Juno Beach for D-Day
David Macdonald serves as an Air Force mechanic overseas
Sam Garnet joins the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Joseph Gautreau serves with the Army in Belgium
Fraser Muir completes his first trip as part of the Bomber Command
Harold MacLauchlan serves in the Navy
Bruce Cox serves as a paratrooper during the Battle of Arnhem
Pauline Cox Walker's ship is torpedoed
Murray Whetung enlists in the Army
William Jepps enlists in the Navy and participates in the Murmansk Run
John Neville is deployed to France
Louis Howard and crew aboard HMCS Sarnia fail to make contact with HMCS Esquimalt
Hewitt Quick is deployed to Europe as a paratrooper
Wladyslaw Pasaj, after hiding from the Germans, boards a train for Scotland
Leo Pikulski takes part in the battle for Mont Ormel Ridge
Marie Venne serves in the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) - Women's Division
Art Lang is deployed overseas as part of the Army
Alice Samuels trains in Vermilion with the Canadian Women's Army Corpy (CWAC)
Daniel Lee enlists in the Army
Jospeh Forest enlists in the Army
Rodolophe Lavoie completes his first tour with the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
John Deluca participates in a raid of Wanne-Eckel in Germany
Gerald Connick sends birthday wishes home to his wife
Leslie Clarke is wounded while fighting in Carpiquet
Kenneth Richardson is en route to serve in Europe when his son is born
Bob Worrell is promoted to Corporal in the Army
Horace Hetherington trains in England with the Canadian Army
Leraine Munn serves as an Infantry Signaler in the Battle of Ortona
Giles Doucet and crew run into a pack of submarines on the Atlantic
Ivan Killam serves as a guard in York when the war ends
Doreen Newton joins the Canadian Women's Army Corps (CWAC)
Clinton Hayward returns home on SS Ile de France
Robert Breau continues Army training in Greenock, Scotland
Fred Kirkpatrick enters the Air Force and serves at the Chatham base
Mark Macdonald enlists in the Army and serves in the North Shore Regiment
Allan MacDonald sees action in the Battle of Verrieres Ridge
John Everard MacLean is housed with fellow recruits in Ditchling, UK
Bob Phair is wounded while fighting in Sicily
Donovan Woelfle enlists in the Merchant Navy
Joan Johnson goes to Trafalgar Square to celebrate VJ-Day
Gordon Waters leaves the Air Force to join the Army
Benjamin Kenny joins theRoyal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
John Leach lands additional tanks on the shores of Normandy
Fred Bryant serves in France as a medical officer
Owen Lockyer and the 4th Canadian Armoured Regiment arrive in Normandy
Ruby Somers becomes a Women's Royal Navy (WRN) and is stationed in Newfoundland
Henry Masters enlists in the Army
Eileen Green is married to Tom Green while serving as a Women's Royal Navy Service (WRNS)
Molly Campbell serves as a nursery nurse in England
Belmont Shannon participates in D-Day landings
William Hitchon serves as protection for the Royal family in England
Clyde Bougie travels to Hong Kong to free prisoners of war
Audrey Detheridge is called to duty in Toronto for the Canaadian Woman's Army Core (CWAC)
Edward Jesseman is wounded in Germany
John Bylik enlists in the Navy
John Cathie and troops land in Italy
Harold Shaw and his twin brother enlist in the Air Force
Sol Zulauf enlists in the Army
Mendel Thresher is interrogated by Germans on induction to a Prisoners of War (POW) camp
Jan Szklarz is serving in the Polish Army when he is captured by Germans
Harold Hall enlists in the Army
Frederick Chapman and his regiment land in Sicily
Joe Bill is wounded while fighting in France
Warren Urquhart enlists in the Navy
Bill Teleske is stationed in the trenches in Ortona, Italy on Christmas Eve
Ross Hamilton serves in the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) 407 Squadron in Sussex
Roman Zaraza serves in the Polish Army in Lithuania
Godfrey Schaupmeyer and his division serve in the Falaise Gap
Stephen Boczar and his squadron complete air raids on Berlin
Rudy Deutsch enlists as a stretcher bearer in the Army
Gordon Wright participates in the English Channel blackade leading up to D-Day
Frank Wong serves in the 2nd National Workshop Unit in Caen, France
Victor Wong serves as a "Zombie" for the Canadian Army
Peggy Lee serves in the St. John's Ambulance Corps
Norm Jenkins enlists in the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) and oversees engine and propellor manufacturing
Joseph Sullivan serves in the 3rd Canadian Infantry Division during D-Day
Fred Guest finishes his tour with Bomber Command during the Battle of the Bulge
Gordon Ritchie and 429 Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) Squadron are attacked while on mission in France
Gordon MacKenzie partcipates in the Battle of Ortona
Leonard Bookbinder serves in the navy on HMCS New Liskeard
Robert O'Conner enlists in the Air Force
William Rawluk and the Calgary Highlanders land in France
Jean Holmes enlists as a nurse with the Army and serves in England
Maurice White lands in Sicily, Italy
Roy Page lies about his age and enters the Army
Doug Dickson proposes to his future wife with the ring he paid for by flying under a bridge in Lethridge, AB
George Ens enlists and trains in Camp Borden, Ontario
Jim Venables serves in the 435 Squadron making runs in Burma
Russell Earl completes a bombing raid in Calais, France
Paul Bentley is stationed in Shaftesbury, England before D-Day
Harold ward transfers over to the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Arthur Dean participates as an Air Bomber in a raid on Nuremburg, Germany
Archie Stover is part of Canadian reinforcements in France
George Ufnal and troops spend Christmas in Ortona, Italy
Bill Baluk has his first mission in Bomber Command over Ludwickshaven, Germany
Joe Hickson enlists in the Air Force
Diane Hawthorne serves in the army during the London Blitz
Vernon Barr participates in D-day
Alexander Bramson begins service on HMCS Ettrick
Lawrence Weldon completes his Navy training in Toronto, Ontario
Beryl Howe enlists with the Women's Royal Navy Service (WRNS) as a cryptologist
Alfred Warford serves in the army during the Battle for Caen
John Wasilenchuk and crew are torpedoed off the coast of North Africa
Catherine Anderson is called to duty for the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Edwin Badger enlists in the Navy
Edward Plummer enlists in the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Ian Herd's fellow navigators die in a crash off the coast of Sri Lanka
Eugene Steeves enlists in the Air Force
Richard Dutka is captured by Germans after his plane is shot down after a bombing raid
Kenneth Marchant finishes his basic training and is shipped to BC
George Heron and crew support troops already in Normandy
Herbert Britton and crew arrive in France
Hugh Kidney enlists in the Army and serves as a dispatch rider
Aldfred Carpenter serves as in the Navy doing minesweeping
Harry Inns and the 621 Strike Squadron make their way up the eastern coast of Africa
Robert Yule boards RMS Aquitania to serve in Europe
Albert Hogg enlists as a medic for the Army
Blanche Lund performs as a dancer for troops with the Navy Special Service
Richard Clements is called to serve in the Army
Paul Chan and troops are deployed to Sri Lanka
Wendell Harper gets a surprise attack by a German air fighter
Oscar Fetini joins the Army in his native Egypt
Weldon Moffatt performs his first mission for the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Stanley Creelman spends Christmas fighting in Ortona, Italy
Daniel Goniea is called to serve in the Navy
William Sheppard arrives in Normandy
Lloyd Queen and reinforcements arrive on Juno Beach
Herbert Heron gets married in Canada
Cyril Hammond trains with the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Frank Reneau begins serving in the Navy
Robert McGirr enlists in the Army
Stanley Anderson is wounded in battle
William Elliot joins the Army as a driver
Clarence Sweeney enlists in the Navy
Joan Manning runs into her childhood friend before he is sent back into battle
Raymond Lefrancois joins the navy over the Army
Leo Fortin begins primary training in Quebec
Clifford Mizzen qualifies as an air gunner
Romuald Pepin is certified as a gunner with the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Emile Turcot and troops take the city of Oldenburg, Germany before the war ends
Roland Gravel survives the raid on Dieppe
Jacques Catudel is stationed in Vancouver during Victory in Japan Day
Léon DesLauriers enlists in the Army
Percy Jackson decides to stay and serve in Germany for another year
Marcel Caron is called to serve in the Army
Geoffrey Knowles participates in the Battle for Kangaw in Burma
Farnand Giguere is wounded while training in Farnham, Quebec
Charles Marinier enlists in the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Jean-Paul Bertrand and the 2nd Division hold a number of surrendered Germany troops
Henri Botham enlists in the Air Force
Georges Charrier is aboard HMCS Windflower when it collides with a cargo ship
Marc Boivin trains with the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) Alouettes Squadron when the war ends in Japan
Victor Guérin is stationed with D Company, Royal 22nd Regiment, during the Battle for Ortona
Frederick Gray serves with the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) in Madras, India, during VE-Day
Rena Chaplin begins training in the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) - Women's Division
Gerald Derick travels to Europe to fight in the trenches
Norma Dillon is on night duty in Toronto during the Normandy Invasions
Jerry O'Conner is captured as a German Prisoners of War (POW)
Harry Fogel celebrates in London during VE-Day
Joseph Abramovitch lands in Italy
Hyman Sazant enlists in the Special Forces
Doug Mullen is transferred to British Columbia as part of the Air Force
Robert Perry enlists in the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) as an air bomber
John Mornan is sworn into the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Alexander Paton and troops land in France to capture the Carpiquet airport
James Lovie finishes his tour and returns to Britain
Gillis Mackinnon serves in a hospital for Allied troops
George Kehl begins active service with the Navy
June Melton transfers to a hospital in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia
Lorna Collacott gets married on her Friday off in England
Selwyn Stephens begins service with the Air Force
Bert Barker tries to join the Air Force 3 months too young
Arthur Drake participates in the raid on Dieppe
John Kubis and crew of HMCS Rockcliffe capture a German submarine
John O'Neill and troops sail to Normandy, only to be recalled and invade the next day
Kenneth McKenzie enlists in the Army
John Anderson performs a bomb sweep in Bethune, France
Orille Hogue participates in the "big push" to close the Falaise Gap in France
John Harmer sees Japanese kamikaze pilots attack HMS Victorious
Sheridan Atkinson participates in the Allied landing of Sicily
Joan Dowe serves in the Women's Army Corps (WAC) with the coastal defense of Britain
Howard O'Conner serves as bomber pilot in the Royal Air Force (RAF)
Kent Ford is training for Pacific bombing operations when Victory in Japan is declared
Elisabeth Wallis serves in a naval hospital during D-Day
Roderick White begins service in England
Peter Chance is stationed in Malaysia with the Navy
Cyril Yarnell enlists in the Air Force and tours with the 403 Squadron
Agnes Ward and fellow Women Division (WDs) depart for England
Valerie Simmons survives a bombing in a London nightclub
Frank Round and troops fight their way up the Liri Valley in Italy
John Beach finishes his medical training early and serves in the Royal Canadian Army Medical Corps (RCAMC)
Allen Lucas enlists as a soldier in the Army
Jim Caird operates as a tank driver in the town of Rijssen, Holland
Margaret Duff is stationed in Scotland with the Air Force
Robert Fletcher is commisioned into the Air Force and serves in North Africa
Bill Hoag is bombed while stationed in Burma
Frank Boyd enlists in the 101 RAF Squadron
Frederick Nash and crew crash into a German submarine
Dietrich Puetter enlists in the German Air Force
Gordon Redcliffe joins the Air Force as a mechanic
William Husson bombs the Obersaltzburg, Hitler's hideaway in the Swiss Alps
Bruce Bullock is injured while fighting in the Battle for Monte Cassino
Lorne Yule enlists in the Air Force as a mechanic
Maurice Hundleby is sent to the European front
Margaret Fletcher tends to troops injured in the Battle of Caen
Eugene Gosh begins service in the Navy
Lillian Wylie serves in the British Women's Land Army working in agriculture
Nora Oliver joins the WRENS and works for Lord Mountbatten's headquarters
Isobel Smith joins the air force first as a cook, then as a nurse's aid
Charles Lepine enlists in the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF)
Fred Russell enlists in the Air Force as a musician
Daisy Bird enlists in the Women's Auxiliary Air Force
Fred Coonstable begins service in the Navy
John Kirk returns home to Victoria, British Columbia
Philip Bissell enlists in the Navy
Terence Elworthy is a cadet when he is called to service in Hong Kong
Pater Thomas and crew are attacked by a German submarine in the Bay of Biscay
Kenneth Pask enlists in the Air Force and serves in the South Pacific
Norma Curry joins the Women's Auxiliary Air Force
Mr. Richards arrives in Horsham, England
Albert Walsh enlists in the Army
Arthur Anderson is relocated in a Prisoner of War (POW) camp
Wilson Large fights in the Battle of Dieppe
Henry Seewald joins the Air Force and builds radios
Wilma Cooke travels to European Front as a nurse
Hilda Senter serves is Egypt with the Air Force
Joyce Mullen finishes her training with the Royal Canadian Air Force Women's Division
John Shaw completes his Engine Room Artificer Apprenticeship with the Navy
Walter Weir joins The Royal Regina Rifles Regiment in the Army
Henry Love and troops cross the Straits of Messina in Italy
John Yeomans is shot down while returning from air raid over Germany
Donald Bowman and crew on HMSC Edmunston sink a German submarine
